thread.title: Savannah attorney Pat O'Connor sworn in as president-elect of State Bar of Georgia
thread.title_full: Savannah attorney Pat O'Connor sworn in as president-elect of State Bar of Georgia | savannahnow.com

author: Jan Skutch
title: Savannah attorney Pat O'Connor sworn in as president-elect of State Bar of Georgia
text:
Photos Patrick O’Connor By Jan Skutch
The State Bar of Georgia’s governing body on Saturday elevated Savannah attorney Patrick O’Connor to president-elect of the 46,000-member group, moving his plans to become bar president up a year.
The action by the bar’s Board of Governors, meeting in Savannah, elected O’Connor unopposed from interim president-elect to fill the unexpired term of attorney Rita A. Sheffey who resigned earlier this month.
He was immediately sworn in as president-elect.
O’Connor, 59, was elected as treasurer and took office in June for the state’s bar.
O’Connor will remain as both treasurer and president-elect until new elections in the spring.
Traditionally, once an attorney is named president-elect he automatically becomes president the following year. However, since O’Connor was elected by the board and not the membership, he could face opposition in the next election. He could have been opposed Saturday but no attorney did so.
He has expressed interest in moving up the chairs to become the unified bar’s 55th president after completing terms as treasurer and president-elect.
O’Connor is only the second Savannah attorney to fill any of the four core offices of the “big bar” since Frank “Sonny” Seiler held the president’s post in 1973.
Statesboro attorney Gerald Edenfield was the most recent from the area when he was bar president in 2008.
